title: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
author: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
created_time: September 07, 2023, 03:06:17 AMLast edit: May 09, 2024, 10:30:22 PM by CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
content: Moving up in weight and sats! For sale are the 5 gram silver round and bar. They both have a denomination of 150,000 SatsYou can buy them as buyer funded for $65 ea or 0.0011 BTC ea + $10 Shipping to USAIf you want one fully funded it will cost  0.0065 btc ea + a current Funding fee + $10 Shipping to USAIf you buy a unfunded piece, they will be hand stamped "BF" for Buyer FundedI can ship to MJ for any sales too.  Material: 999 SILVERShape:  BAR and RoundDenomination: 150,000 SatoriFunded and BF: Piece will be marked BF if it is chosenMintage: Each Shape has 250 available

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Please don't release too many (silver) bars, I have a weak spot for them. Probably need to snag at least one or two of them, will send you a dm soon, probably today or tomorrow.

comments.author: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
comments.created_time: September 07, 2023, 03:14:45 PMLast edit: November 24, 2023, 03:40:03 PM by CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
comments.body: Quote from: Kryptowerk on September 07, 2023, 01:32:40 PMPlease don't release too many (silver) bars, I have a weak spot for them. Probably need to snag at least one or two of them, will send you a dm soon, probably today or tomorrow.I have a deep love for fractional silver bars myself. These are beautiful bars. They are in my top 5 favorite pieces out of all physical bitcoin pieces. Unfortunately for you, I have 10g silver bars and rounds on the drawing board.   Will have a small amount of gold bars available by years end. They are made from Caribbean gold "treasure" jewelry refined to pure 999 shot. Then turned into 14k gold for better durability over the years for trade.

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Is the USD price of $100 fixed for these (funded)? At the current Bitcoin rate that's around 0.00268 BTC. Or is it $60 in BTC + the loading of 0.0015 BTC?I think I wanna pick up two bars, loaded - if still available.

comments.author: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
comments.created_time: November 23, 2023, 03:08:59 AMLast edit: November 23, 2023, 08:59:02 AM by CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
comments.body: Quote from: Kryptowerk on November 21, 2023, 12:47:13 AMIs the USD price of $100 fixed for these (funded)? At the current Bitcoin rate that's around 0.00268 BTC. Or is it $60 in BTC + the loading of 0.0015 BTC?I think I wanna pick up two bars, loaded - if still available. The price for the bar stays the same. It's $60 in BTC if you want the Buyer Funded piece. I stamp it with BF.  If you want it funded, it will be whatever the current price of 150,000 sats is plus a funding fee. This listing was posted before BTC jumped up over 30k.Total for 2 funded pieces would run 0.00692 btc. That includes priority shipping. Still pretty reasonable for 2 fully funded pieces on precious metals. $129.34 ea if you want to break it down. I'd like to see one of these auctioned off on Stack and Bowers. They are definitely a hidden treasure. Caribbean Treasures

Caribbean Treasures  Ah yeah, that makes sense.What's the rate if shipping within US?Stack and Bowers for 1st time is always interesting - but can the bars be slabbed in a way they'll also be graded?It would depend on the size of the bars.  For ICG, no dimensions can be over 40mm.  PCGS could accommodate but maker has to be on or added to their list.

comments.author: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
comments.body: 3 sold!Prices updated as of 5/09/24You can buy them as buyer funded for $65 ea or 0.0011 BTC ea + $10 Shipping to USAIf you want one fully funded it will cost  0.0065 btc ea + a current Funding fee + $10 Shipping to USAIf you buy a unfunded piece, they will be hand stamped "BF" for Buyer FundedIf you see another items that hasn't been updated in a while, just ask for new prices.
